intro: Aconitum zigzag subsp. ryohakuense, commonly known as the Ryohaku mountain aconite, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features compound leaves with a zigzag pattern, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its toxic alkaloids make it a plant requiring careful handling.
